document_data.mainbody: '''Scarbradro's Haven''' was an inn catering to [[caravan]] crews in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The Haven was situated within the city walls, almost directly next to its southernmost gate.{{Cite interactive atlas|3830 Baldur's Gate}}
document_data.Structure: Old and drafty, the Haven resembled an oversized, unadorned stone barn stretching four stories tall.

Interior.Atmosphere: The inn seemed to always be filled with guests, with many stopping by just to eat a cheap meal.

document_data.Services:
The Haven served warm meals, usually consisting of [[stew]]s, dark [[nutbread]] and their own [[ale]]. Hot [[broth]] was served in the winter and on cold days.

In addition to serving as an inn, Scarbradro's Haven provided wagon crews with stables, storage for their coaches, and a warehouse.
document_data.Inhabitants: The owner and operator of the inn, [[Horlo Scarbradro]], was a scarred, burly man who had retired from his career as a caravan master. He was well loved by his patrons, who referred to him as "Our Scar". The staff was known for their skill in the art of violence. Additionally, Horlo employed a number of younger errand-boys who also served as his spies.
